To simplify the expression $\sqrt{27}$, we can look for the largest perfect square that divides 27. In this case, it is 9. We can rewrite the expression as:

$\sqrt{27} = \sqrt{9 \times 3}$

Since the square root of a product is the product of the square roots, we can rewrite this as:

$\sqrt{27} = \sqrt{9} \times \sqrt{3}$

Now, we know that $\sqrt{9} = 3$, so the simplified expression is:

$\sqrt{27} = 3\sqrt{3}$
